titlestmt.titleproper: Bryn Mawr College campus architectural plans and schematic drawings collection 1879-1967
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Bryn Mawr College campus architectural plans and schematic drawings collection

bioghist.p: Bryn Mawr College was founded in 1885. It was the first women's higher education institution to offer graduate degrees, including doctorates.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of architectural plans and schematic drawings of the Bryn Mawr College campus and Canaday Library. Included are campus layouts from 1879 to 1914, fragments of an 1895 campus map, and floor plans for Canaday from 1967.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
